message.content:
A Hendiadys is a figure of speech in which two words or phrases are combined to create a single expression that conveys a meaning more forcefully than either word would alone. It originates from the Greek "hendiaismos," which means "one through." In English, some common examples include:

- "Black as coal"
- "Clean as a whistle"
- "Deafening silence"

The use of a Hendiadys can help emphasize the intensity or quality of an action or state.
